headline: Extremely High Expression Across Tachyzoites and Bradyzoites with Dramatic Silencing During Sexual Development
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits exceptionally high expression in Toxoplasma gondii asexual stages, consistently ranking in the 98th-99th percentile across multiple experiments. Key expression patterns include:
  • Peak expression in bradyzoites (2,713 TPM, 99.66th percentile) and tachyzoites (1,593-4,767 TPM)
  • Dramatic >400-fold upregulation during oocyst sporulation
  • Complete silencing (<3 TPM) in all feline enteroepithelial sexual stages
  • Biphasic expression pattern during tachyzoite time courses
The consistent high expression in replicating stages and complete repression during sexual development suggests this gene encodes a critical component of the asexual replication machinery, possibly involved in DNA replication, cell division, or metabolic processes essential for rapid parasite multiplication but incompatible with sexual differentiation.

topics.headline: Exceptionally High Expression in Bradyzoites and Tissue Cysts
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows peak expression levels (758-2,713 TPM, 97th-99th percentile) across multiple bradyzoite experiments, indicating critical importance during chronic infection stages.

topics.headline: Biphasic Expression Pattern During Tachyzoite Development
topics.one_sentence_summary: Multiple tachyzoite time-course experiments reveal a characteristic biphasic expression pattern with early peaks (2-4 hours), mid-course dips (8-22 hours), and late recovery phases (36-44 hours).

topics.headline: Massive Upregulation During Oocyst Sporulation
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression increases over 400-fold from unsporulated to sporulated oocysts, reaching 99th percentile levels and indicating essential roles in sporozoite formation and oocyst maturation.

topics.headline: Complete Silencing During Sexual Development in Feline Host
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows >300-fold downregulation from asexual stages to all feline enteroepithelial stages, representing one of the most dramatic stage-specific repressions observed in the parasite lifecycle.

topics.headline: Strong Stage-Specific Expression Favoring Tachyzoites Over Merozoites
topics.one_sentence_summary: Tachyzoites show 355-fold higher expression than merozoites, indicating strong stage-specific upregulation during the rapidly dividing asexual phase compared to the sexual merozoite stage.

topics.headline: Cell Cycle-Regulated Expression in Synchronized Parasites
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression shows clear periodic regulation during the cell cycle with two peaks (early-mid and late cycle phases) and 2.5-fold differential expression between minimum and maximum levels.

topics.headline: Consistent High Expression Across Host Cell Types and Infection Models
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene maintains exceptionally high expression (97th-99th percentile) across diverse host cell types, infection conditions, and parasite strains, indicating constitutive importance during active infection.
